广告牌 https://www.billboard.com音乐排行榜、新闻、照片和视频2023 年 8 月 3 日星期四 01:52:27 +0000 en-US每小时1 https://wordpress.org/?v=6.2.2 亚历杭德罗·费尔南德斯 (Alejandro Fernández) 凭借《No Es Que Me Quiera Ir》登上拉丁音乐播放榜首https://www.billboard.com/pro/alejandro-fernandez-latin-airplay-no-es-que-me-quiera-ir/Pamela Bustios Thu, 03 Aug 2023 01:52:19 +0000 Chart BeatMusic#1 - Espanolbb latinBBLatin https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235384159 It also marks a new milestone achievement for singer-songwriter Eden Muñoz, who captures his first No. 1 as a songwriter.

亚历杭德罗·费尔南德斯 (Alejandro Fernández)在Billboard 拉丁音乐排行榜上第十次排名第一，《No Es Que Me Quiera Ir》以 13-1 的成绩领先于 8 月 5 日的调查。这首歌是在两周冠军“Caballero”之后发布的，这是他这十年（2020 年 2 月）的第一个职业生涯第一名。

根据 Luminate 的数据，《No Es Que Me Quiera Ir》在 7 月 21 日至 27 日的跟踪周期间在美国获得了 910 万观众印象，比前一周增长了 50%，从而征服了 Latin Airplay。这首歌的主要支持者包括 Univision 电台、洛杉矶 KSCA 和芝加哥 WOJO（由 Mediabase 监测，Mediabase 为 Billboard 排行榜提供 Luminate 数据。）

由 Eden Muñoz 创作的 Ranchera 于 5 月 19 日发行，将罗伊斯王子 (Prince Royce) 的《Me EnRD》一届排名第一后从领先位置逐出，巴恰塔 (bachata) 的观众印象数下降 1-5，观众印象数下降 17%，至 840 万。

此外，“Que Me Quiera Ir”为环球音乐拉丁裔/UMLE 赢得了 2023 年第二个第一名，此前该厂牌以 Karol G 和 Shakira 的“TQG”在 5 月至 7 月期间连续两周占据排行榜冠军。

如前所述，随着“Me Quiera Ir”在 Latin Airplay 上夺得桂冠，费尔南德斯获得了他的第十个冠军，在墨西哥地区艺人中排名第二，落后于 Marco Antonio Solis，后者在他的 Latin Airplay 帐户上继续以 11 个冠军领先。此外，“Que Me Quiera”成为他自 2020 年“Cabaellero”以来的首场胜利。在此期间，他五次进入前十名，自 1994 年 12 月“A Pesar de Todo”达到第十名以来，总共 23 次进入前十名。

以下是费尔南德斯 10 位领导人的完整回顾，可以追溯到 1997 年他的第一位领导人：

巅峰、头衔、艺术家、排名第一的周数
1997年10月18日，“Si Tú Supieras”，六
1997 年 12 月 27 日，“En El Jardín”，主演格洛丽亚·埃斯特凡 (Gloria Estefan)，六岁
1998 年 3 月 14 日，“No Se Olvidar”，八
1998 年 7 月 18 日，“Yo Nací Para Amarte”，五
1999年8月21日，《疯子》一
201 年 12 月 1 日，“Tantita Pena”，六
2004年10月23日，“Me Dedique A Perderte”，二
2010年2月6日，“Se Me Va La Voz”，其中
2020年1月4日，“Caballero”，二
2023 年 8 月 5 日，“No Es Que Me Quiera Ir”，其中

值得注意的是，《Que Me Quiera Ir》标志着创作型歌手艾登·穆尼奥斯 (Eden Muñoz) 取得了新的里程碑式成就，他作为词曲作者在拉丁电台 (Latin Airplay) 上首次获得第一名。此前，他通过 Banda Carnaval 的“Esa Vez Soy Yo”（2020 年 1 月）获得了歌曲作者第二高的成绩。

在其他地方，“Que Me Quiera Ir”在墨西哥地区 Airplay中以 7-1 的比分晋级，成为本周的最大赢家。费尔南德斯赢得了他的第六个冠军，在墨西哥地区独奏家中排名第五。

; Triller 申请在纽约证券交易所直接上市https://www.billboard.com/pro/triller-going-public-direct-listing-new-york-stock-exchange/Glenn Peoples Thu, 03 Aug 2023 01:27:51 +0000 BusinessTechFinanceMusic StocksTrillerverzuz https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235384157 In 2022, the short-form video app had a net loss of $195.6 million on revenue of $47.7 million.

Triller 是一款类似 TikTok 风格的短视频应用程序，根据该公司周三发布的S-1 文件，该公司计划通过直接上市的方式在纽约证券交易所出售其普通股，股票代码为“ILLR”。 . 2).该文件没有提供直接上市的日期。

直接上市——不是首次公开募股（IPO）——不会有承销商承担向机构投资者出售上市股票的财务风险。直接上市在 2018 年受到 Spotify 的欢迎，它避免了 IPO 的路演和确定初始售价的簿记过程。 Triller 将不会从其股东在直接上市中发行的股票中获得任何收益。

尽管 TikTok 2022 年的收入估计为 94 亿美元，并且正在成为唱片公司和音乐出版商的重要版税来源，但 Triller 的规模要小得多。 2023年第一季度，这个自称为“人工智能驱动的技术平台”的收入为910万美元，净亏损为2880万美元。 2022 年，Triller 净亏损 1.956 亿美元，收入为 4770 万美元。

S-1 描绘了一家陷入财务困境、存在众多悬而未决问题的公司。截至 3 月 31 日，Triller 仅有 220 万美元的现金和现金等价物。该公司的 S-1 警告称，Triller 自成立以来每年都出现亏损——这对于高增长的科技初创公司来说并不罕见——累计赤字达 12.9 亿美元。例如，Triller 可能会因与环球音乐出版集团的未决诉讼而产生额外费用，并承认没有遵守“大量”音乐许可合同的付款义务，并且对供应商“逾期付款”为 Triller 提供工程、营销和法律服务等。

S-1 还透露，Triller 于 2023 年 7 月 21 日与索尼音乐娱乐公司签订了一份保密和解协议，要求其就 SME 于 2022 年提起的违约诉讼向 SME 支付款项。5 月 16 日，Triller 被被勒令向 SME 支付近 460 万美元。和解协议为特里勒提供了付款计划。直接上市后 15 天，Triller 将有义务根据和解协议向 SME 付款。

Triller 将拥有两类普通股：每股一票的 A 类普通股和每股 10 票的 B 类普通股。重组完成后，Triller 的创始合伙人 Proxima Media 和Bobby Sarnevesht将持有 Triller 约 15.4% 的普通股，并拥有公司总投票权的 60.6%。除Proxima Media外，其他持有已发行普通股5%以上的股东还包括卡内基科技公司首席执行官保罗·波斯纳(Paul Posner)和蔡明兴。截至 3 月 31 日，Triller 已发行 282,017,038 股 A 类普通股和 46,651,382 股 B 类普通股。

Triller 声称，截至 3 月 31 日，拥有超过 5.5 亿用户帐户和超过 240 万创作者，比两年前增加了近 10 万。它通过收购建立了用户基础，例如2021 年收购了 Verzuz ，这是由Swizz Beats和Timbaland创建的直播平台，在疫情期间一举成名。 Swizz Beatz 和 Timbaland 于 2022 年 8 月对 Triller 提起 2800 万美元诉讼，指控其未支付交易中承诺的款项。一个月后，该诉讼在庭外和解。

周三（8 月 2 日），特拉维斯的团队宣布即将于 10 月 24 日在阿拉巴马州亨茨维尔的 VBC 普罗普斯特竞技场举办一场招待乡村音乐名人堂成员的音乐会，“向兰迪·特拉维斯致敬的英雄和朋友”。

; Meta 推出音乐 AI 工具，可根据文本提示生成即时歌曲https://www.billboard.com/pro/meta-releases-text-to-music-ai-tools/Kristin Robinson Wed, 02 Aug 2023 23:45:38 +0000 BusinessTechAIartificial intelligencemeta https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235384112 The company's AudioCraft consists of three different models that serve as competition to a similar tool released by Google in May.

该公司周三（8 月 2 日）宣布，Meta 推出了 AudioCraft，这是一套新的人工智能模型，可以根据文本提示生成音乐和音频。

该技术由三个模型组成：MusicGen（音乐）、AudioGen（音效）和EnCodec（更高品质的音乐）。它是 Google MusicLM 的新竞争对手，MusicLM 是5 月份推出的文本音乐生成器。

有关的

谷歌的人工智能文本音乐生成器 MusicLM 现已向公众开放

2023年8月2日

使用“晚宴上的深情音乐”或“沙漠中的电影场景与打击乐”等提示，用户只需单击按钮即可生成音乐。根据该公司的公告，它将该技术视为一种“新型乐器——就像合成器首次出现时一样”。

MusicGen——AudioCraft 套件中用于制作音乐的模型——接受了 20,000 小时 Meta 拥有和专门授权的音乐的训练。该公告并不清楚 EnCodec 是否接受过任何受版权保护的材料的培训，或者是否遵循与 MusicGen 相同的指导方针。 Meta 没有立即回复Billboard 的置评请求。

培训是新兴人工智能行业最具争议的领域之一。为了产生人类质量的输出，人工智能模型在数百万或数十亿个数据点上进行训练，以了解它们正在复制的内容的属性——而世界上许多最大的人工智能公司在未经授权、补偿甚至不知情的情况下使用受版权保护的材料训练他们的模型版权所有者的。

MusicGen、AudioGen 和 EnCodec 都将作为开源模型提供。这将允许研究人员和从业者访问，以便他们可以使用自己的数据集训练自己的模型，比 Meta 最初推出的版本更进一步推进 AudioCraft 工具，并解决该公司对偏见的担忧，包括其对西式音乐的倾向——最大的一部分其训练集。

“音乐可以说是最具挑战性的音频类型，因为它由本地和远程模式组成，从一组音符到具有多种乐器的全局音乐结构，”Meta 在一篇博客文章中说道，并指出它的系列模型“能够产生高质量的音频”，并且具有一致性和易用性。

; 卡莉·雷·杰普森 (Carly Rae Jepsen) 在新专辑《最可爱的时光》中畅谈以“大声、无畏的方式”生活https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/carly-rae-jepsen-the-loveliest-time-album-interview-1235384067/Rania Aniftos Wed, 02 Aug 2023 23:18:44 +0000 MusicPopMusic NewsThe Loveliest Time https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235384067 "I don’t think I could have gotten to 最可爱的时光，而不经历最孤独的时光，”她谈到她最近的两张姊妹专辑时说道。;

要了解Carly Rae Jepsen是如何完成她最近发行的第七张录音室专辑《The Loveliest Time》的，我们必须从 2020 年开始，当时这位流行歌星在因 COVID-19 大流行而处于隔离状态时创作了整个音乐项目。

“我想面对我的孤独，写下我在那个地方发现的所有发现，”她向《告示牌》讲述当时冲击她的创作灵感。 “我的想象力去了一些相当极端的地方。我有一个想法，我应该给我的前任发短信并重新点燃这段糟糕的关系吗？ [笑]写关于你因孤独而产生的所有极端反应的歌曲很有趣，比如加入约会应用程序或去一些反思的地方，在那里你思考你所做的选择或对你没有做的事情的悲伤。终于有时间拆开包装了。我确实将孤独这个主题视为一个非常酷的起点。”

于是，2022 年的《最孤独的时光》诞生了，其中充斥着专辑主打歌《西风》、《海滨别墅》等社交媒体热门歌曲，在粉丝孤独的时刻陪伴着歌迷。但杰普森并没有放弃通过孤立来实现增长的理念。 “我一直希望将这件作品视为一个整体，”她解释道。

在 2022 年繁忙的巡演日程中，杰普森仍然抽出时间重温了一些未入选《孤独时光》的 B 面歌曲。 “我认为，在某种程度上，离开一段时间然后再回到他们身边可以帮助我对他们产生新的看法，”她谈到这些歌曲时说道。 “离开事情然后回来看它是有力量的，我觉得这对我解开这些歌曲中需要解决的一些事情真的很有帮助。”

这种焕然一新的能量催生了这张名为《最可爱的时光》的专辑，该专辑于 7 月 27 日正式发行。她最近的两个项目被收录到姐妹专辑中。 “这只是我的想象，‘当世界开放时会怎样？’以及爱和能够旅行的极限，比如以这种真正大声、无所畏惧的方式生活。我想，如果不经历最孤独的时光，我就不可能到达最可爱的时光。”

这张专辑准确地捕捉了她音乐生涯中最美好的时光，展示了杰普森新的、实验性的和自由奔放的一面，她演奏独特的声音，同时仍然忠于她活泼、多彩的个性。她特别提到了“Psychedelic Switch” ，这是一首为狂欢而准备的曲目，其前奏出人意料地延长，最后进入了欢快、超凡的副歌。 “如果你听到《Psychedelic Switch》的开头，它仍然是舞蹈风格的，但速度更慢了。这是[制片人兼联合编剧]凯尔·希勒 (Kyle Shearer) 的作品，当新冠疫情之后世界开放时，他开始与妻子一起狂欢。他走进录音室，我还没有看到任何热门的时刻，他说，“所以，我已经迷上了锐舞音乐。”他开始演奏《Psychedelic Switch》，听起来就像一场狂欢，我说，“我们走吧！”这种有趣的能量不仅体现在我再次与人们面对面创作的经历中，也体现在参与其中的每个人身上，我认为它带来了这种能量，‘哦，天哪，这是我们的复兴音乐。'它给我带来了一些新的、疯狂的能量。”

另一方面，在《最可爱的时光》中，杰普森也进行了更深层次的内省，正如《Kollage》中所见，在这首中速歌曲中，这位 37 岁的超级巨星在处理心碎和痛苦时坦诚了自己的脆弱。 “我认为通过《最孤独的时光》以及一些为他们提供更多深度的歌曲，我意识到我的听众似乎真的很欢迎它，”她在谈到准备变得更加脆弱时说道。 “我意识到我被‘允许’做任何事情。事实上，没有“允许”。这些规则是谁制定的？只要我的音乐给人真诚的感觉。开始写一些更加细致入微的主题，这对我来说感觉很耳目一新——在流行音乐行业呆了这么久，我觉得自己不必那么千篇一律或黑白分明。”

她最后完美地展现了她现在作为一名艺术家的身份：“一切都是如此美妙的灰色以及介于两者之间的一切。”

; Believe Gives AI a Vote of Confidence as Company Revenues Climb 18% https://www.billboard.com/pro/believe-ai-confidence-revenues-h1-2023/Glenn Peoples Wed, 02 Aug 2023 22:52:03 +0000 BusinessRecord Labelsartificial intelligencebelieveDenis LadegaillerieEarnings ReportsFinance https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235384052 Artificial intelligence "will rapidly be available to elevate the quality of the music," said CEO Denis Ladegaillerie while delivering midyear earnings.

With artificial intelligence creating widespread doubt and confusion throughout the music business, Believe gave the technological advancements a strong vote of confidence in the French music company's midyear earnings report on Wednesday (Aug. 2).

“We do think that generative AI, and what we're seeing in the market, will empower every artist to make high quality music,” said CEO Denis Ladegaillerie . Believe sees AI having significant impacts in creativity. Ladegaillerie continued, “We think that for a large part of our business for our automated solutions [division], technology will rapidly be available to elevate the quality of the music, allowing younger artists, developing artists to compete faster in the mid-level market segments and towards the top with higher quality music and accelerate their learning curve to improve their craft.”

Ladegaillerie's message was markedly different from that of major labels who tend to present AI as a cause for music content that floods digital platforms and steals value from more deserving — living and breathing — artists. Last week, Universal Music Group CEO Lucian Grainge drew a line between “real, actual human beings who have real, actual fans” and “those devoted to gaming the system, to committing fraud, to flooding the platform with content that music fans do not want.”

While Grainge's frequent comments about AI are underpinned by royalty concerns, Ladegaillerie's comments on Wednesday also focused on how AI can help Believe perform its basic functions — marketing, promotion — more cost effectively. In the first half of the year, Believe further developed what it called “AI-enabled discovery solutions” and “explored” both partnerships with “several leading digital service providers” and “investments on core internal AI and generative AI use cases.”

“We've been, for several years now, building machine learning models to be able to optimize the marketing and promotion of our artists of their tracks on various digital music services to help them expand market share and new services,” said Ladegaillerie.

AI may play a significant role in the company's future, but in the first half of 2023, Believe's financial performance was driven mainly by its growing roster of artists and labels, a strong showing in its home country of France and solid growth in the rest of Europe. Believe's revenue in the first half of 2023 grew 17.9% to 415.4 million euros ($445 million at the average exchange rate in the period).

Digital revenue grew 18% (20.5% at constant currency) but was hampered by moderate growth in ad-support streaming revenues and foreign exchange rates that turned unfavorable for the euro in the first quarter of 2023 “and even more” in the second quarter, the company stated.

Revenue at Believe's premium solutions division grew 17.9% to 388.5 million euros ($416 million). Revenue at the automated solutions division, which includes digital distributor TuneCore, rose 17.1% to 23 million euros ($25 million).

In France, Believe had a 27% share of the country's top albums — 40 of the top 149 titles — and four of the top 10 artists. In that market, the label AllPoints was the top hip-hop label and had 22 albums in the top 200. Ladegaillerie said the achievement “demonstrates the ability over time to build on a track record of success with a mix of breaking new artists as well as working with established artists where we have long-standing relationships.”

European revenues excluding France and Germany — Believe's two largest markets — grew 23.9% to 121.9 million euros ($131 million). The company attributed the improvement to the acquisition of Sentric Music Group in the UK, which added 7.5 million euros ($8 million) of revenue in the period, and “a strong growth trajectory” in South Europe and Eastern Europe.

Believe singled out its 10-year anniversary of operating in Southeast Asia in fast-growing markets such as Indonesia, the Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam and Malaysia. Its Southeast Asian roster generated more than 634 billion of streams and views over the past 10 years. Believe expects the region's paid streaming users will grow from 15 million today to 67 million in 2030.

Looking ahead, Believe lowered its expectations for full-year organic growth to 14% from 18% and raised its target for adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, amortization and depreciation margin to 5.5% from 5%.

Believe's earnings release was timed after the close of the market and did not impact its share price. Year-to-date, Believe's share price is up 5.6% and at Wednesday's closing price of 11.20 euros per share ($12) gives the company a market capitalization of roughly 1.1 billion euros ($1.2 billion).

Believe's financial metrics:

  • Total revenue increased 17.9% to 415.4 million euros ($445 million). Premium solutions revenue rose 18% to 388.5 million euros ($416 million) and automated solutions revenue grew 17.1% to 26.9 million euros ($25 million).

On July 19, two days before Barbie and its soundtrack would arrive, over 150 independent record stores across the country were celebrating early with listening sessions of the star-studded Barbie: The Album .

“We've actually never done [that] for a soundtrack release before,” says Kevin Weaver , Atlantic Records' West Coast president and the album's co-producer (alongside Mark Ronson and Atlantic's executive vp/co-head of pop/rock A&R, Brandon Davis ). Meanwhile, the label's international teams were making sure that retailers around the world were involved, too, resulting in an impressive global reach.

“This is the largest scale activation we've ever done for something like this,” continues Weaver. “And the feedback that I got from our teams internally was that this was the most successful activation of this nature that we've ever done.”

Barbie: The Album debuted at No. 2 on the Billboard 200, boasting the largest sales week on vinyl for a theatrical film soundtrack (33,000) since Luminate began electronically tracking music sales in 1991. Overall, the album opened with the biggest week (by units earned) for a theatrical film soundtrack in over four years. (The last soundtrack to score a bigger week was Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper 's A Star Is Born ).

Weaver says he and his team thought about their vinyl strategy on day one of planning for the soundtrack. “We had identified the value and the importance of being able to deliver the music with enough time to be able to manufacture the vinyl and get it out into the world for street date. It was [one] of the most critical aspects of what we were doing.”

Nashville Record Pressing (NRP) began pressing the album in May (the plant says a 10-week lead time is typical), ensuring the physical copies would be ready by the album's release date. The plant manufactured a total of seven variants, with five currently being offered on the soundtrack's official web store: hot pink, sky blue, milky clear (Amazon exclusive), cotton candy (Barnes & Noble exclusive) and neon pink (Urban Outfitters exclusive). In all, the first run was estimated at 100,000. “That's a good sized run for an [original soundtrack], and does indicate strong demand for the title,” says Drake Coker , CEO of NRP, which is owned by GZ Media. “Which makes sense, given the strength of the film.”

Given the months-long lead time, Weaver admits he and his team were “really nervous” about the music leaking. And while the label has a long track record of successful soundtrack releases, Barbie was its own beast. “We have songs from the biggest superstars in the world,” he says, noting a handful of whom were kept a secret until the last minute.

“Historically on these kind of projects – I've done The Greatest Showman, Suicide Squad , Fast and Furious – we've been able to get a physical product on day and date. Historically, that's been a CD. Usually, we follow with the vinyl and it's an afterthought,” says Weaver. “Here we just knew the critical importance of that not being the case.” While Barbie: The Album is also available on CD and cassette, he and his team identified early on that vinyl would be a key format for Barbie ’s biggest fans.

“We knew that the core demo was ferociously out there buying up whatever merch and product they could get their hands on, and we were able to work very closely with Mattel to really understand their core consumer,” says Weaver. “It just felt like it was going to be so culturally relevant that the vinyl was going to be a collector's item as much as an audio listening experience.”

As such, various versions kept coming — and might still. On Friday (July 21), the release date for both the film and soundtrack, an expanded version of the album also arrived: Barbie The Album (Best Weekend Ever Edition) . It featured two bonus tracks, including Ryan Gosling's cover of “Push” by Matchbox Twenty (which Gosling sings in the film) and a cover of the Indigo Girls ' “Closer To Fine” — which also plays an integral role in the movie — performed by Brandi Carlile and her wife, Catherine Carlile. Weaver says those two songs have been added to “various configurations of the physical product.”

Fans will also notice “Barbie Dreams” by FIFTY FIFTY featuring Kaliii is missing from the original pressing of the soundtrack. That, along with “Choose Your Fighter” by Ava Max (which appears on the hot prink variant) has since been added to a limited edition repress of the sky blue vinyl. It's currently available for pre-order, with a ship date of Sept. 22.

“We tried to keep feeding what would be available on the physical side,” says Weaver. “There are definitely overarching conversations between myself and my creative partners — [director] Greta Gerwig and Mark Ronson and filmmakers and the studio — about what are ways in which we can continue to support the music brands here and the appetite within.” An exclusive Record Store Day release isn't out of the question, with Weaver promising “cool new iterations” ahead. (Weaver says the coolest of all is the custom version called Kevin the Album , made with exclusive cover art in honor of his birthday.)

While it seems the Barbie hype won't die down anytime soon, Weaver is allowing himself a moment to look back on what he and his team pulled off. “Having the vinyl and being able to deliver it to the consumer the way that we did was one of the funnest aspects of the whole project,” he says. “It's something that I'm really proud of and something that I'm really glad we were able to figure out how to accomplish.”
